@graph.caption: Mexican Stuffed Zucchini with Cashew Cheese

@graph.name: Mexican Stuffed Zucchini with Cashew Cheese - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: These Mexican stuffed zucchini with cashew cheese are seriously to die for! They are also really healthy and easy to make.

@graph.headline: Mexican Stuffed Zucchini with Cashew Cheese

@graph.name: Mexican Stuffed Zucchini with Cashew Cheese
@graph.description: These Mexican stuffed zucchini with cashew cheese are seriously to die for! They are also really healthy and easy to make.
recipeIngredient: one block smoked tofu (7 oz), cut into cubes
1/2  cup unsweetened almond milk (If necessary add more water.)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the rice according to the instructions on the package.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the rice according to the instructions on the package.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the zucchini lengthwise into halves and scoop out the insides of the zucchini halves with a small spoon. Grease them with olive oil (one tablespoon).
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the zucchini lengthwise into halves and scoop out the insides of the zucchini halves with a small spoon. Grease them with olive oil (one tablespoon).

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pan, heat about one tablespoon of olive oil and stir-fry the tofu cubes for about 4 minutes until they're golden and crispy. Add the onions and sautée for 3 more minutes until translucent. Then add the garlic and sautée for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pan, heat about one tablespoon of olive oil and stir-fry the tofu cubes for about 4 minutes until they're golden and crispy. Add the onions and sautée for 3 more minutes until translucent. Then add the garlic and sautée for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the cooked rice, the tomato paste, and the water. Add the kidney beans, the corn, and the spices.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the cooked rice, the tomato paste, and the water. Add the kidney beans, the corn, and the spices.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and put the zucchini shells on top. Fill the Mexican rice into the zucchini shells.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and put the zucchini shells on top. Fill the Mexican rice into the zucchini shells.

recipeInstructions.text: Then make the cashew cheese: Drain the cashews and place them into a food processor together with the rest of the ingredients. Process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Then make the cashew cheese: Drain the cashews and place them into a food processor together with the rest of the ingredients. Process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the cheese sauce on top of the stuffed zucchini and bake them at 350 °F for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the cheese sauce on top of the stuffed zucchini and bake them at 350 °F for 20 minutes.
